issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: RMContainer lost queue name when RM HA happens

comments.body:
Thanks [~ziqian hu] for reporting and work on the patch. 

Could you create a patch on top of trunk? That's typically what we do fixes. 

The patch should be named (JIRA_NUMBER.version.patch). You can check https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/HowToContribute for details.

And for the patch, instead of getting application inside the func, you can pass queue name from external function ({{recoverContainersOnNode}}), which can avoid accessing scheduler application once.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |
\\
\\
|| Vote || Subsystem || Runtime || Comment ||

| {color:red}-1{color} | {color:red} patch {color} | {color:red}  0m  7s{color} | {color:red} YARN-8232 does not apply to trunk. Rebase required? Wrong Branch? See https://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/HowToContribute for help. {color} |
\\
\\

[~leftnoteasy], thanks for your comment.

I resubmit 2 version of this patch, one is based on trunk, another one is based on branch-2.8.3 which is the version on our product environment.

And I get the queue name outside the recoverContainersOnNode func and pass it by parameter in new version.

+1, thanks [~ziqian hu], will commit tomorrow if no objections.
Committed to trunk / branch-3.1. thanks [~ziqian hu]!

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #14141 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/14141/])
YARN-8232. RMContainer lost queue name when RM HA happens. (Hu Ziqian (wangda: rev 6b96a73bb0f0ad1c877a062b19091e3e15a33ec4)
* (edit) hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/resourcemanager/scheduler/AbstractYarnScheduler.java
* (edit) hadoop-yarn-project/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-server/hadoop-yarn-server-resourcemanager/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/yarn/server/resourcemanager/scheduler/TestAbstractYarnScheduler.java
Thanks, [~ziqian hu]!  We recently ran into the same issue on 2.8 as well, so I committed this to branch-3.0, branch-2, branch-2.9, and branch-2.8.
